result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamar Donte Franklin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g) [Modifiers: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Jail], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.
  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g) [Modifiers: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Jail], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All court costs, surcharges to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two, and consecutive to 15CF988.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Defendant advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; also advised that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

records.addlTxt: Decision and Order DENYING Request For Eligibility for the Earned Release Program (ERP). Order received, signed, and filed with court.
letter dated 3/2/2016 to defendant from postconviction, filed
Original GUILTY PLEA & SENTENCING Transcript (24 pages) commencing 11-17-2015 received and filed.  CH

Defendant Jamar Donte Franklin in court with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.  Defendant Jamar Donte Franklin in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case to be resolved with 15CF988.
AS to each of the charged counts:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Sentencing proceeded.
AS to each count:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, concurrent with each other and consecutive to 15CF988.  CONFINEMENT of 5 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant remanded.

State requests this case be scheduled for status in Branch 38 on 11-17-2015.
